page.title: 03WITHINGTON ST.MICHAEL'S.
page.content: The Church yard which was surveyed in 1984 by members of the Withington Women's Institute,contains over three hundred memorials ranging from simple stone vase to large table tombs. An interesting inscription was found on a grave to "Honest John Stockwell" who died of the{plague in 1665.} The earliest part of the church was built in 1150. Interesting features are: {Five mass dials}which have survived since mediaeval times on the south wall of the church.They were used to tell villagers the times of services. There are{two Norman doorways}on the south and north sides of the Church. The south doorway which is protected by a porch is a beautiful example of Norman work. Most valuable items of church plate are held in the cathedral treasury.
